meanings.definition: The quality of being acrid or having a sharp, bitter taste.
meanings.sent1: The acridnesses of the lemon made my face scrunch up.
meanings.sent2: I could taste the acridnesses of the burnt toast.
meanings.sent3: The acridnesses of the vinegar in the salad dressing made my brother pucker his lips.
meanings.sent4: The acridnesses of defeat lingered in the air long after the game was over.
meanings.sent5: The acridnesses of the medicine were hard to swallow.

meanings.definition: The state of being acrid or having a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The acridnesses of the garbage filled the room with a foul odor.
meanings.sent2: I wrinkled my nose at the acridnesses of the smoke from the fire.
meanings.sent3: The acridnesses of the skunk spray made everyone run for cover.
meanings.sent4: The acridnesses of the chemicals in the lab stung my nostrils.
meanings.sent5: The acridnesses of the spoiled milk made me gag.
